snippet: Discrimination based on beauty rests on the same sexist principle as discrimination against the ugly. And both rest on the power of the male gaze.
abstract: Op-Ed article by sociology professor Michael Kimmel highlights Iowa discrimination case brought by dental assistant Melissa Nelson against her former employer, who fired her for being too attractive; contends that discrimination based on beauty is rooted in the same sexist principle as discrimination against the ugly, and both rest on the power of the male gaze.
lead_paragraph: Discrimination based on beauty rests on the same sexist principle as discrimination against the ugly. And both rest on the power of the male gaze.
